sections.body: (1) This Act may be called the Official Secrets Act, 1923. (2) It extends to the whole of Pakistan, and applies also to all citizens of Pakistan and persons in the service of Government wherever they may be.
In this Act, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context, definitions of terms such as 'document', 'prohibited place', and others are provided.
A person commits an offence under this Act if they engage in activities that compromise official secrets.

sections.section_title: Restriction against photographs, sketches, etc., of prohibited and notified areas
sections.body: Prohibits the taking of photographs or sketches in certain areas.

sections.section_title: Communications with enemy or foreign agents to be evidence of commission of certain offence
sections.body: Establishes that communication with enemies or foreign agents is evidence of committing an offence.
Defines wrongful communication of information as an offence.

sections.section_title: Unauthorized use of uniforms; falsification of reports, forgery, personation and false documents
sections.body: Criminalizes unauthorized use of uniforms and related activities.
Prohibits unauthorized disclosure of identities related to official secrets.

sections.section_title: Interfering with officers of the police or members of the armed Forces of Pakistan
sections.body: Criminalizes interference with law enforcement or military personnel.

sections.section_title: Duty of giving information as to commission of offences
sections.body: Mandates individuals to report knowledge of offences.
Criminalizes attempts or incitements to commit offences under this Act.
Establishes penalties for those who harbor spies.
Details the authority to issue search warrants in relation to offences.
Grants powers of arrest to designated authorities.
Outlines procedures for investigation of offences.
Imposes restrictions on the trial of certain offences.
Allows for exclusion of the public from certain legal proceedings.
Holds companies accountable for offences under this Act.
Empowers the appropriate government to make rules for the implementation of this Act.
